channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Independent thinkers required! Mid/Senior-level Developer for an innovative London company
item.description: Have you ever worked for a company with a micromanagement style, where a boss was constantly breathing down your neck? Do you hate spending more time in meetings about product requirements than actually getting on with building the product?

item.title: AprÃ¨sâ€“Perlâ€¦ski! Junior and Senior roles in the Swiss Alps
item.description: Picture an idyllic village high up in the Swiss Alps, with expansive views down to the valley below and the craggy mountains in the distance. There is a smell of fresh pine in the air, and the sound of streams burbling by. Now picture a traditional wooden chalet nestled in that village, housing a busy team of Perl developers working with the latest Perl technologies. Seems unlikely? Well, lovers of the great outdoors will be delighted to hear that this is a reality!

item.title: Contract Role - 6 months onsite in west London
item.description: The nights are closing in and winter is looming. Itâ€™s easy to get a bit down at the prospect of 6 months of grey British weather ahead. But, as the old idiom says, a change is as good as a restâ€¦ and here we have a role that can provide an exciting new challenge to tide you through the winter.

item.title: Call for Papers
item.description: mdk is getting an early start on preparations for The Perl Conference in Glasgow, August 13-17, 2018. The Call for Papers is now open.

item.title: Call For Lightning Talks -- London Perl Workshop
item.description: The LPW is coming up on the 25th of November, and the day will end with Lightning talks. Submit yours now!

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: CPAN6 is here
item.description: Perl 6 finally gets support for CPAN! It's usable, and you should start using it at once!

item.title: Strawberry Perl 5.26.1.1 and 5.24.3.1 released
item.description: Strawberry Perl has released new 5.24 and 5.26 versions

item.title: Iridium Flare End-Of-Life
item.description: Tom proposes deprecation of Astro::Coord::ECI::TLE::Iridium, as the Iridium fleet is updated.

item.title: Fancy a Game of (Code) Golf?
item.description: Coding as a game? Come show off your coding talent with a round of code golf!

item.title: #324 - Mad Scrambles sometimes find the coolest news
item.description: I let my weekend get away from me, so I'm hustling around to find you some news. Start planning now for 2018 events! mdk is already hard at work for the European Perl Conference in August, so what's your excuse? Also, kind of huge news on the Perl 6 front--there is a CPAN for Perl 6!
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
